This screen allows you to unilaterally close your channels.

This is not a "fix-everything" magic button: it is here as a safety measure and should only be used in extreme scenarios. For example, if your peer (ACINQ) disappears permanently, preventing you from spending your money. In all other cases, if you experience issues with Phoenix you should contact support.

Force closing channels will cost you money (to cover the on-chain fees) and will cause your funds to be locked for days.

Do not uninstall the app until your channels are fully closed, or you will lose money.

Do not use this feature if you don't fully understand what it does.

Phoenix allows you to receive payments on Bitcoin's blockchain (L1) and Bitcoin's Lightning layer (L2). 

 - the blockchain layer (L1) is slower, and generally much more expensive (requires miner fees) 
 - the Lightning layer (L2) is much faster, and generally much cheaper (especially for smaller payments) 

 When you receive a payment on L1, Phoenix will automatically move the funds to L2 IF the miner fees adhere to your configured fee policy. 

 Payments you receive on L2 can be received instantly and for zero fees. However, occasionally an L1 operation is also required in order to manage the L2 payment channel. This can be done automatically IF the miner fees adhere to your configured fee policy.
Accelerate my transactions.
You can make all your unconfirmed transactions use a higher effective feerate to encourage miners to favour your payments.
